author: Simon Difford
description: Sweetening with agave nectar rather than sugar helps set this fruity Caipirinha apart and creates a drink that is very slightly sweet.
name: Blackberry Agave Caipirinha

recipeInstructions.text: Cut lime in half (from pole to pole) and then slice one of the halves into eight 3-4mm thick half-moon shaped segments and drop into the base of a robust rocks glass and MUDDLE
Add blackberries and MUDDLE some more
When sure fruit juice is fully extracted and the sugar dissolved, transfer the muddled fruit and sugar into serving glass (preferably a 30cl / 10oz hi-ball glass)
Add agave syrup to serving glass
POUR cachaça (stored in the freezer) into the rocks glass (used to muddle) and swirl to rinse glass before pouring cachaça into serving glass
STIR to ensure all ingredients are well mixed
Crack (rather than crush) four to five large ice cubes and drop into serving glass
STIR before topping with more ice and serve with a stirrer (but no straws)
